description: The requirement for selectable data residency (US-003) introduces extreme architectural complexity, which could lead to a catastrophic compliance breach.
mitigation_strategy: Mandate a formal architectural design spike and review before implementation. Build a proof-of-concept.
contingency_plan: De-scope the initial launch to a single, pre-defined region and defer multi-region support.
monitoring_trigger: Architectural spike fails to produce a viable implementation plan within one sprint.

description: Over-reliance on a complex, monolithic set of Firestore Security Rules increases the probability of a misconfiguration leading to data leakage between tenants.
mitigation_strategy: Enforce 95%+ test coverage for all security rules using the Firebase Emulator Suite. All rule changes require approval from two senior engineers.
contingency_plan: Maintain a pre-written, highly restrictive 'lockdown' ruleset for immediate deployment in case of a vulnerability.
monitoring_trigger: A security rule unit test fails in the CI/CD pipeline.

description: Reporting features (US-059, US-061) will have extremely slow performance or fail entirely for large tenants if not backed by a pre-aggregation strategy.
mitigation_strategy: Mandate a server-side data aggregation strategy from the outset using scheduled Cloud Functions to create daily summaries.
contingency_plan: Limit reporting scope to short, fixed date ranges (e.g., 'last 7 days') for initial release.
monitoring_trigger: Load tests against reporting queries exceed the 3-second performance NFR.

description: High key-person dependency on the Senior Backend Developer, creating a single point of failure for critical architecture and security tasks.
mitigation_strategy: Enforce mandatory pair programming for all 'High' complexity backend tasks. Actively cross-train the Full-Stack developer.
contingency_plan: Allocate budget for an on-demand external Firebase consultant.
monitoring_trigger: Over 80% of critical backend tasks are assigned to the same individual over two consecutive sprints.

description: Offline data synchronization (US-034) is subject to inconsistent OS background processing rules, which could lead to data loss.
mitigation_strategy: Implement a robust auxiliary local database (e.g., Drift) to reliably track pending write timestamps. Conduct extensive E2E testing on physical devices.
contingency_plan: Pivot design to guarantee sync only when the app is in the foreground, with prominent UI indicators for pending syncs.
monitoring_trigger: E2E automated tests show a data loss rate > 0.5% in simulated network-loss scenarios.
resolution_timeline: 2 weeks for enhanced local DB implementation

description: The automated tenant hard-delete function is an extremely high-risk operation. A bug could lead to accidental, irreversible deletion of active customer data.
mitigation_strategy: The function must run in 'dry run' mode by default. It must have redundant safety checks. Requires sign-off from two senior engineers.
contingency_plan: Immediately invoke the Disaster Recovery plan to restore from the last daily backup.
monitoring_trigger: A 'dry run' of the deletion function logs an incorrect tenant for deletion.

description: Inefficient Firestore queries in scheduled functions or abuse of public endpoints (e.g., SMS pumping) can lead to significant GCP cost overruns.
mitigation_strategy: Implement strict GCP budget alerts. Enforce code reviews for all queries in scheduled functions. Implement Firebase App Check on all public endpoints.
contingency_plan: Temporarily disable the highest-cost scheduled function while re-architecting its queries.
monitoring_trigger: A GCP budget alert fires indicating projected spend will exceed the budget.
